justification: The article states, “To detect the anxiety level of the participants, the so-called ‘State Trait Anxiety Inventory’ (STAI) were used… the STAI-Y version contains 40 self-reported items which aims to assess the trait anxiety as a stable character, as well as the state anxiety about a specific event.”

“Next, to screen the cognitive status of the individuals, the ‘Montreal Cognitive Assessment’ was utilized… this assessment contains cognitive tasks which require visuospatial, memory, attention, concentration, language, abstraction, as well as orientation skills.”

measured_by: Discriminative Response Task (go/no-go) with ERP recordings
justification: During screening, “the ERP data during a discriminative task on the computer were measured… participants were asked to press a button… when a target stimulus appeared (go/no-go task). Hence, the response time (RT) as well as the accuracy were measured,” linking the DRT to assessment of executive control processes.

Under Functional Fitness Battery, the authors note that “the ‘Four Square Test’… was performed” to assess the participants’ physical performance suited for detecting functional fitness in the elderly.
The same battery included “the ‘Functional Reach Test’… performed” as part of the physical fitness assessment for older adults.
Physical assessment also used “the ‘Time up and go Test’… performed” with scores compared pre- and post-intervention to gauge changes in functional mobility.
